intro: Haloragis maierae, commonly known as the Maier's willowherb, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Haloragis maierae plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
